title: Collider Winter Preview Unveils Exclusive Casting News , Images , and Sneak Peeks From 99 Must - Watch Movies and Series
body_text:
After a sizzling selection of the summer's best exclusives, Collider returned with a bigger and better preview week this fall. Now, following the huge success of both events, we are back with the biggest preview event yet this winter. From a brand-new look at the likes of Wicked: For Good, The SpongeBob Movie: Search For SquarePants, and Five Nights at Freddy’s 2, to exclusive clips from some of the most exciting new movies and shows across the world, this winter preview week has been Collider's biggest yet. With exclusives from nearly 99 titles in just six days, there has been plenty to keep up with. To make sure you haven't missed a beat, here's a full round-up of this most impressive preview event yet in this recap of every exclusive we debuted this week.
'In Your Dreams'
Now streaming on Netflix
For those looking for a viewing option that caters to the whole family, In Your Dreams is a go-to. The Netflix animation, directed by Alex Woo and Erik Benson, follows Stevie (Jolie Hoang‑Rappaport) and her brother Elliot (Elias Janssen), as they grapple with their parents' recent divorce. In the hopes of saving their parent's marriage, the siblings resort to the world of dreams to find The Sandman, a mysterious figure who has the power to grant wishes. Our sneak peek of the film shows Stevie and Elliot on an adventurous ride, as they fly through the clouds while hanging on to the bed frame as if their lives depended on it.
Get all the details about In Your Dreams in our exclusive preview.
'Tinsel Town'
Release Date: November 28, 2025
Christmas is right around the corner, and with it comes an array of holiday titles, including this one. In Tinsel Town, Kiefer Sutherland plays Bradley Mack, a washed-up action star who heads to an English village after securing a role in an idiosyncratic Christmas pageant. While there, he not only bonds with a strong-willed choreographer (Rebel Wilson), but sees an opportunity to repair his relationship with his daughter. Our exclusive look at the holiday film shows Bradley on stage holding a massive snowman in one hand and a mic in the other, likely entertaining audiences with his performance.
Get all the details about Tinsel Town in our exclusive preview.
'Playdate'
Now streaming on Prime Video
Kevin James and Alan Ritchson plan a playdate in Prime Video's latest offering. The action comedy follows Brian (James) and Jeff (Ritchson), two parents who decide to spend an easy-going afternoon with their sons, tossing footballs and engaging in small talk. Yet, they are instead thrust into a chaotic scramble to stay alive, as ruthless mercenaries hunt them down. While Brian has no physical strength for battle, Jeff is oddly prepared to face the criminals head on. In the clip above, the main characters are being chased by Brian's ex-girlfriend, Leslie (Isla Fisher), and her friends. From the likes of it, Leslie is thirsty for revenge, and won't back down until she gets what she wants.
Get all the details about Playdate in our exclusive preview.
'Now You See Me: Now You Don't'
Release Date: In Theaters Now
Right now, global theaters have been sprinkled with magic as the hotly anticipated Now You See Me: Now You Don’t begins its box office run. Earlier this week, as part of Collider's Winter Preview Event, we debuted four exclusive images from the threequel, available to view above. Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Dave Franco, and Isla Fisher all reprise their roles as the original Horsemen, joined by a new batch of budding magicians, played by Justice Smith, Dominic Sessa, and Ariana Greenblatt. Directed by Ruben Fleischer, the movie promises plenty of twists and turns as the Horsemen face their most ambitious adventure yet.
Get all the details about Now You See Me: Now You Don't in our exclusive look.
'A Merry Little Ex-Mas'
Release Date: On Netflix Now
Christmas came early in Collider's Winter Preview Event, with a brand-new image of Netflix's latest holiday-themed rom-com, A Merry Little Ex-Mas. Starring Alicia Silverstone, fresh off her role in Yorgos Lanthimos's latest movie, Bugonia, and Oliver Hudson as exes getting together for one final family celebration before they split up forever, the movie promises to usher in the festive season on the world's biggest streamer. Directed by Steve Carr and penned by Holly Hester, the film is the latest in a long line of similar Netflix Christmas movies, with the platform continuing its bid to be known as the go-to festive streamer.
Get all the details about A Merry Little Ex-Mas in our exclusive look.
'Bat-Fam'
Now Streaming on Prime Video
A new Batman animated series has arrived on streaming, and it functions as a spin-off to the 2023 hit holiday film, Merry Little Batman. Bat-Fam is centered on Bruce Wayne (Luke Wilson), Damian Wayne (Yonas Kibreab), and Alfred Pennyworth (James Cromwell), as they welcome three new residents to Wayne Manor. The series will explore how this family of misfits (pictured in the image above) navigate the fun and chaos of Gotham City, as they work together to protect civilians from luring threats. Balancing both comedy and action, this animation, developed by Mike Roth & Jase Ricci, will surely fill the DC superhero void since the releases of Superman and Peacemaker Season 2.
Get all the details about Bat-Fam in our exclusive preview.
'Champagne Problems'
Release Date: November 19, 2025
Directed and written by Mark Steven Johnson, Champagne Problems is set to be your next rom-com obsession as it makes its debut on November 19. Starring Ransom Canyon favorite Minka Kelly as a huge moment in her professional career is interrupted by the arrival of Slow Horses alum Tom Wozniczka, with an unlikely romance blossoming. As part of Collider's Winter Preview Event, we debuted an exclusive image of the pair getting cozy and surrounded by the magic of Christmas as love begins to simmer. Alongside Kelly and Wozniczka, the movie also stars All Quiet on the Western Front's Thibault de Montalemert, Sean Amsing, Flula Borg, Astrid Whettnall, Xavier Samuel, Mitchell Mullen, and Maeve Courtier-Lilley.
Get all the details about Champagne Problems in our exclusive look.
'Jingle Bell Heist'
Release Date: November 26, 2025
If you're a fan of Christmas movies but want something with a bit of an edge, Netflix has you covered as Jingle Bell Heist debuts later this month on November 26. Blending the heart of holiday-themed rom-coms with heist movie thrills, Jingle Bell Heist follows Olivia Holt and Connor Swindells as two people down on their luck who seek to take their small-time thieving to new heights as they plan to steal from London's most notorious department store. As part of Collider's winter Preview Event, we debuted an image of Holt and Swindells dressed in the finery of expert con artists. The movie is directed by Michael Fimognari, best known for helming the two sequels to the hit teen flick To All the Boys I've Loved Before.
Get all the details about Jingle Bell Heist in our exclusive look.
‘My Secret Santa’
Release Date: December 3, 2025
The Christmas exclusives just kept on coming in Collider’s Winter Preview Event, as we teamed up with Netflix to bring a brand-new look at another of their stacked upcoming festive line-up. In the exclusive image of the upcoming My Secret Santa, scheduled to debut on December 3, fans are treated to Cross star Ryan Eggold as Matthew and Sister, Sister’s Tia Mowry as Natascha in conversation outside a luxury ski resort. Directed by Mike Rohl of The Princess Switch fame and penned by the duo of Carley Smale and Ron Oliver, My Secret Santa also stars Alexandra Breckenridge, Madison MacIsaac, and Diana Maria Riva.
Get all the details about My Secret Santa in our exclusive look.
'Murder at the Embassy'
Release Date: In Theaters Now
Whilst you wait for the next Knives Out movie (more on that later), there's an enticing crime waiting to be solved in theaters and on digital platforms. That mystery is the heart of Murder at the Embassy, a film that follows the Agatha Christie-loving Miranda Green, played by The O.C. star Mischa Barton, as she is called to investigate a murder at the British Embassy. However, she soon starts unraveling a second crime that could have catastrophic global consequences. As part of Collider's Exclusive Winter Preview Event, we debuted the image above, showcasing Barton's crime-solver surrounded by ancient Egyptian relics. A sequel to 2023's Invitation to a Murder, the movie is directed by Stephen Shimek and penned by Mark Brennan.
Get all the details about Murder at the Embassy in our exclusive look.
'Last Samurai Standing'
Now streaming on Netflix
Netflix's latest series, Last Samurai Standing, is set during the end of an era, as fallen samurais are warped into a violent game called Kodoku. What draws them into this competition is the opportunity to win a cash prize that could be their key to overcoming poverty and surviving a cholera outbreak. However, the catch is that only one samurai will make it out alive, and based on the exclusive picture above, we have our theories on who that might be. With a premise reminiscent to that of Squid Game, Last Samurai Standing is an action-packed, Japanese production that will leave you on edge.
Get all the details about Last Samurai Standing in our exclusive preview.
'Thing With Feathers'
Release Date: November 28, 2025
Grief can come in various shapes and forms, and Thing With Feathers displays that full well. Based on Max Porter’s novella, the film follows Dad (Benedict Cumberbatch) as he strives to keep it together for his young boys after his wife's death. One of the ways he copes with grief, is by getting even more focused on his work as a graphic novelist. In turn, one of his creations, a gigantic crow (voiced by David Thewlis), leaves the page and becomes an ever-present figure in Dad's daily life. This unhinged and unwanted house guest turns out to be exactly what the protagonist needs to move forward. In addition to sharing an exclusive look at Cumberbatch's character alongside his two sons, we are sharing a new trailer.
Get all the details about Thing With Feathers in our exclusive preview.
‘The King of Color’
Release Date: December 2025
It isn’t just fiction films and shows that get their place in Collider’s Winter Preview Event, as documentary fans are also treated to exclusives from the best and newest from the world of non-fiction. As part of our week of exclusives, we have debuted the above image from the upcoming documentary The King of Color, scheduled for release in December 2025. Directed by Patrick Creadon, this inspiring documentary looks at the life of Larry Herbert, the inventor of the Pantone Matching System, and uncovers the way in which he changed the universal language of color forever. The synopsis for the doc reads:
“At 96 years old, Larry Herbert, known as THE KING OF COLOR, is a visionary whose revolutionary idea to standardize color remains largely unrecognized. Growing up in Depression-era Brooklyn, Larry entered the print and manufacturing trade during a time when color was a chaotic and subjective experience. He channeled his unique vision into creating the Pantone Matching System—a groundbreaking invention that established a universal language for color, profoundly enhancing artistic expression and commercial production across all industries.”
Get all the details about The King of Color in our exclusive look.
'The Things You Kill'
Now in theaters
This Turkish thriller explores the aftermath of revenge, when guilt and darkness take over. The Things You Kill follows Ali (Ekin Koç), a progressive university professor who is torn between academic work in Ankara and staying in a small town caring for his mother who is ill. As he wrestles between both options, his mother suspiciously dies, unlocking in Ali an inner rage he has been harboring against his father. This drives him toward revenge, recruiting his gardener to do the dirty work for him. The sneak peek above shows the moment in which Ali regrets what he did, and must live with the consequences.
Get all the details about The Things You Kill in our exclusive look.
'Bunny'
Now in select theaters and VOD
Ben Jacobson might've been featured in High Fidelity and Blink Twice, but he is now ready to make his debut behind the camera. His film, Bunny, follows a hustler (Mo Stark) on a quick job until everything goes sideways. Unsure what to do, he requests the help of his best friend, Dino (Jacobson), and together they come up with an elaborate scheme to get rid of a dead body. With the police on the watch-out, Bunny's ultimate goal is to make it through the night without getting caught, or worse, killed. As chaos reigns and the clock ticks, the duo must rely on each other to carry on with their plan.
Get all the details about Bunny in our exclusive preview.
'Riot Women'
Release Date: January 14, 2026
It's not always that we get to see elderly women rocking the stage, but Riot Women proves that there are menopausal women who are still edgy. The series by Sally Wainwright, follows five women who create a punk-rock band to sign up for a local talent show. Yet, as they begin to work on music of their own, they notice that they have much more to say than they initially thought. With each of them undergoing their own struggles with romantic and familial relationships, the band becomes a catalyst for everything that they are going through. The sneak peek above marks a significant moment in the band's conception, giving U.S. audiences a taste of what they can anticipate from the series.
Get all the details about Riot Women in our exclusive preview.
'The Housemaid'
Release Date: December 19, 2025
Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried are two of the best-known actors working today, so a team-up between the two is sure to demand attention. This December 19, you can catch Sweeney and Seyfried in the upcoming thriller, The Housemaid, an adaptation of Freida McFadden's book, directed by Paul Feig, with this story tonally similar to his previous work on A Simple Favor and its sequel, Another Simple Favor. Also starring 1923's Brandon Sklenar, Michele Morrone, and Elizabeth Perkins, the film follows a woman escaping her past who finds security in a new position as a live-in housemaid, only for a seductive scandal to unleash chaos. Ahead of the movie's arrival, Collider debuted the above image of Sweeney and Seyfried as housemaid Millie and the wealthy Nina, as part of our Winter Preview Event.
Get all the details about The Housemaid in our exclusive look.
‘Come See Me in the Good Light’
Release Date: Available Now
Apple TV might be home to some of the best fiction on television, but the streamer also plays host to a selection of fantastic and often life-changing documentaries. Released this past Friday, Ryan White’s Come See Me in the Good Light “is a poignant and unexpectedly funny love story about poets Andrea Gibson and Megan Falley facing an incurable cancer diagnosis with joy, wit and an unshakable partnership.” In the face of tragedy, this heartwarming partnership proves utterly life-affirming in a documentary you won’t want to miss. As part of Collider’s Exclusive Winter Preview Event, we debuted a brand-new image from the doc showcasing this loving partnership looking beyond.
Get all the details about Come See Me in the Good Light and read an interview with the director in our exclusive look.
‘The Hunt’
Release Date: December 3, 2025
Apple TV have produced some of 2025’s finest content, with their new series Pluribus yet another string to their acclaimed bow. This December, they will widen their impressive collection of enticing international content with The Hunt (Traqués), the upcoming French-language thriller from the César-nominated Cédric Anger (Next Time I’ll Aim for the Heart). Ahead of the show’s December 3 premiere, with two episodes dropping at once on the streamer, Collider teamed with Apple TV to bring this exclusive image from the series as part of our Exclusive Winter Preview Event. The image features four of the series’ stars, Manuel Guillot, Frédéric Maranber, Cédric Appietto, and Damien Bonnard.
Get all the details about The Hunt in our exclusive look.
'Rental Family'
Release Date: November 21, 2025
Three years after winning his first Oscar for Best Actor in Darren Aronofsky's The Whale, the beloved Brendan Fraser is back with Rental Family, a heartwarming comedy-drama from 37 Seconds and Beef director Hikari. Following Fraser as Phillip Vandarploeug, an American man in Tokyo searching for meaning and finding it in the most unlikely of places, Rental Family originally premiered at this year's Toronto International Film Festival, with Collider's Ross Bonaime calling it "a gentle, pleasant story that will surprise you with its affecting narrative." Ahead of the movie's release on November 21, we debuted an exclusive clip, available to view above, as part of our Winter Preview Event.
Get all the details about Rental Family in our exclusive look.
'GOAT'
Release Date: February 13, 2026
It wasn't going to be long before the basketball 'G.O.A.T' debate was to be turned into an animated animal adventure. Scheduled for release on February 13, 2026, Sony Pictures Animation, the team behind Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse, brings to the big screen the story of a young goat, Will (voiced by Stranger Things alum Caleb McLaughlin), who dreams of becoming a professional roarball player. However, all the best roarball players come from the bigger and faster animals in the kingdom, with Will having to overcome the odds to achieve his dream. Ahead of the movie's release, Collider has released the above image as part of our Exclusive Winter Preview Event.
Get all the details about GOAT in our exclusive look.
'Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die'
Release Date: February 13, 2026
What if the only way to combat AI is to enlist ordinary people to come to the rescue? That is what Sam Rockwell's character does in Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die. In the film, he plays a mysterious man who claims to be from a future devastated by an evil AI. In order to stop it from causing further harm, he recruits late-night diner strangers to help him save the world. The exclusive image above shows Rockwell in a circle alongside the strangers he has allied with. Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die is the latest directorial effort by Gore Verbinski, the same mind behind the nerve-wracking horror film, A Cure for Wellness.
Get all the details about Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die in our exclusive preview.
‘No Other Choice’
Release Date: December 25, 2025
One of the hottest movies leaving this year’s Toronto International Film Festival, No Other Choice is the latest project from acclaimed filmmaker Park Chan-wook. The man behind Oldboy and Decision to Leave is bringing thrills and comedic spills to a limited theatrical release this Christmas Day, with No Other Choice, the film selected as the South Korean entry for the Best International Feature Film at the upcoming 98th Academy Awards. Ahead of the movie’s release, Collider can exclusively debut the clip above as part of our Winter Preview Event. In a previous review of the film, Ross Bonaime called it “a contender for best comedy of the year,” and awarded it 9/10.
Get all the details about No Other Choice in our exclusive look.
'Song Sung Blue'
Release Date: December 25, 2025
Musical biopic fans are in for a real festive treat this Christmas Day, as Song Sung Blue premieres in theaters. Starring the ever-brilliant duo of Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson, the film follows a pair of down-on-their-luck musicians who chase their dreams and form Lightning and Thunder, a tribute band to the great Neil Diamond. Also starring the likes of Michael Imperioli, Ella Anderson, King Princess, Mustafa Shakir, Hudson Hensley, Fisher Stevens, and more, the film promises a heartwarming sing-along you won't want to miss. Ahead of its Christmas Day release, Collider debuted the joyous image above as part of our Exclusive Winter Preview Event.
Get all the details about Song Sung Blue in our exclusive look.
'The Abandons'
Release Date: December 4, 2025
Set in 1854, The Abandons follows two matriarchs from two very distinct families trying to make their way in the untamed Washington Territory. Fiona Nolan's (Lena Headey) found family is bound by love and necessity, whereas Constance Van Ness' (Gillian Anderson) family is bound by wealth and privilege passed on from one generation to the next. In spite of their differences, their fate is linked by two crimes, an awful secret, a star-crossed love, and a piece of land with silver underneath. The exclusive image above shows Fiona and her family of outcasts riding their horses and seemingly fighting for justice.
Get all the details about The Abandons in our exclusive preview.
'Nouvelle Vague'
Now streaming on Netflix
Richard Linklater's tribute to French cinema is finally available to stream, after garnering praise throughout its festival run. Nouvelle Vague reimagines the making of Jean-Luc Godard's Breathless, showing how the critic-turned-director (played by Guillaume Marbeck) became the pioneer of the French New Wave. It follows Godard's partnership with actors Jean-Paul Belmondo (Aubry Dullin) and Jean Seberg (Zoey Deutch), as together they made a film that at first glance seemed amateurish, but later became a testament to artistic freedom. In the image above, you can see the trio bonding during the creative process.
Get all the details about Nouvelle Vague in our exclusive preview.
'Sleepwalker'
Release Date: January 9, 2026
Hayden Panettiere will make her scream queen comeback with Sleepwalker, a psychological thriller directed by Brandon Auman. In it, she'll play Sarah, a talented artist who has been tormented by nightmares and visions ever since a car accident led her daughter to die and her abusive husband to be hospitalized. With her vivid dreams impacting her sense of reality, including fooling her into thinking that her husband is out of a coma, Sarah must come to terms with her mind playing tricks on her. In our sneak peek of the film, Panettiere is seen in a protective posture, determined to do whatever it takes to care for herself and her loved ones.
Get all the details about Sleepwalker in our exclusive preview.
'Percy Jackson and the Olympians' Season 2
Release Date: December 10, 2025
The young demigods are taken to the sea in Percy Jackson and the Olympians Season 2. Drawing from the second novel of Rick Riordan's best-selling book series, the new batch of episodes will introduce new monsters and have even more action-packed sequences, the latter being hinted at through the exclusive image above. This time around, Percy (Walker Scobell), Annabeth (Leah Sava Jeffries) and Clarisse (Dior Goodjohn) will go on a quest to save Camp Half-Blood, after its protective border has been breached. They also head to the Sea of Monsters to rescue their friend Grover (Aryan Simhadri) and retrieve the legendary Golden Fleece.
Get all the details about Percy Jackson and the Olympians Season 2 in our exclusive preview.
‘Dust Bunny’
Release Date: December 12, 2025
After writing and producing plenty of acclaimed projects, from Pushing Daisies to Hannibal, Bryan Fuller is finally making his long-awaited directorial debut with Dust Bunny. A horror/thriller that reunites Fuller with Hannibal’s Mads Mikkelsen, who stars alongside Sigourney Weaver (Alien), David Dastmalchian (The Life of Chuck), and Sophie Sloan (Chemistry of Death), Dust Bunny promises to be one of the most enticing theatrical releases this December, with a tale of a monster under a young girl’s bed that eats her entire family. Ahead of the movie’s release, Collider can bring you the above exclusive image from Dust Bunny as part of our Winter Preview Event. In Collider’s previous review of the movie from TIFF 2025, Ross Bonaime wrote:
“With a flair for the surreal and fantastical, it’s easy to see how Fuller’s feature debut could become a cult favorite just like his shows have.”
Get all the details about Dust Bunny in our exclusive look.
‘Rosemead’
Release Date: December 5, 2025
Whilst preparing for her confirmed role in the upcoming sequel to The Devil Wears Prada, the ever-brilliant Lucy Liu is receiving plenty of critical acclaim for her latest starring role in directorial debutant Eric Lin’s Rosemead. Following the film’s successful premiere at the 2025 Tribeca Festival, this emotionally affecting story, inspired by true events, is scheduled to hit US theaters this December 5. Ahead of the movie’s arrival, Collider has exclusively debuted the above image from the movie, featuring a worried Liu as Irene, a mother “who takes drastic measures to protect her troubled teenage son (Lawrence Shou),” after discovering his obsession with mass shootings.
Get all the details about Rosemead in our exclusive look.
'Not Without Hope'
Release Date: December 12, 2025
Based on a true story, Not Without Hope follows Nick Schuyler (Zachary Levi) and his three friends on a fishing trip off the coast of Florida, and get stranded in the sea after their boat capsizes. With a massive storm approaching, the group must battle hypothermia, dehydration, and rely on their limited resources for survival. The film, much like the real events that inspired it, shows that Nick was the only one who made it out alive. In bringing this project to the screen, Levi was very mindful of honoring both the character he was portraying, but also honoring those who perished at sea. In an interview with Collider, he shared the following about telling this story:
"I think being able to be a part of true stories is always very powerful, and particularly ones that show incredible perseverance in the face of insurmountable odds. And, Nick's story is a powerful one, and quite literally, as is based in the name, it is not without hope. He was always just holding onto that last shred of hope in the odds that were against all of those odds. So to be able to tell a story like that is, I think that that's important in this industry."
Get all the details about Not Without Hope in our exclusive look.
'Shetland' Season 10
Release Date: January 1, 2026
It is a major milestone when a TV show is picked up for 10 seasons, and Shetland has been one of the lucky few. The British detective series aired its premiere episode of Season 10 in the U.K., and U.S. audiences will soon get to watch it on BritBox in the new year. According to the synopsis, Episode 1 will uncover the truth behind retired social worker Eadie Tulloch's demise, with her body found days after the incident. With another puzzling case to solve, the exclusive image above seems to indicate that DI Ruth Calder (Ashley Jensen) is in her element.
Get all the details about Shetland in our exclusive preview.
'The Beast in Me'
Now streaming on Netflix
The X Files' writer, Gabe Rotter, has concocted a Netflix thriller that will leave you on edge. It is centered on Aggie Wiggs (Claire Danes), an acclaimed author facing writer's block ever since her son's tragic death. That is until the house next to hers is bought by a real estate mogul who was once the prime suspect in his wife's mysterious disappearance. Intrigued by Nile Jarvis' (Matthew Rhys) past and eager to use her findings as inspiration for a new book, Aggie enters a quest that could easily turn deadly. Both Danes and Rhys are featured in the exclusive image above, walking side by side.
Get all the details about The Beast in Me in our exclusive preview.
‘Wicked: For Good’
Release Date: November 21, 2025
One of the biggest movie events of 2024, the release of Wicked stormed to box office success and defied both gravity and general expectation by also becoming a critical darling and Oscars success. Now, director Jon M. Chu, Cynthia Erivo, and Ariana Grande are back with the hotly anticipated For Good, the second half to the iconic stage musical, which sees the once-shining Emerald City turn grey as the hunt for Elphaba darkens. Ahead of the film’s November 21 release, Collider has teamed up with Wicked to debut an exclusive image of the sequel, as part of our Winter Preview Event, showcasing Elphaba and Glinda hand in hand with Jeff Goldblum’s Wizard.
Get all the details about Wicked: For Good in our exclusive look.
'The Copenhagen Test'
Release Date: December 27, 2025
A Marvel favorite will engage in a trippy espionage journey in The Copenhagen Test. The Peacock series follows Alexander Hale (Simu Liu), a first-generation Chinese-American intelligence analyst whose brain is hacked by an unknown assailant. With everything that he sees and heres getting directed to a stranger monitoring his everyday affairs, Alexander doesn't know who to reach out for help. In order to survive, the character needs to maintain a performance 24/7 in order to potentially get rid of the hacker tormenting him. In our sneak peek of the series, you'll find Liu and modern scream queen Melissa Barrera sharing the screen.
Get all the details about The Copenhagen Test in our exclusive preview.
'The Rookie' Season 8
Release Date: January 6, 2026
The LAPD are about to have their hands full, as The Rookie returns for its eighth season on ABC. This time around, they will go international, heading to Prague to help the FBI solve one of their most daring cases yet. The upcoming season will also answer some questions raised in Season 7's finale, which had Oscar (Matthew Glave) escaping from the Nevada desert without the diamonds he had stolen and Monica (Bridget Regan) getting an immunity deal. Our first look at the Season 8 premiere features John Nolan (Nathan Fillion) and the rest of the team in what seems to be a tense moment.
Get all the details about The Rookie Season 8 in our exclusive preview.
‘Under the Stars’
Release Date: Available Now
Toni Collette fans have been rewarded with a huge treat during Collider’s Winter Preview Event, with not just an exclusive image and clip, but also an exclusive quote from her upcoming romantic comedy, Under the Stars. Starring Collette and Ocean’s Eleven’s Andy Garcia, the film, which is available on VOD now, “follows a novelist stuck in a passionless relationship. When he travels to Italy, he finds the girl of his dreams.” As part of this exclusive, Collider spoke to co-star Alex Pettyfer, who spoke of how the country of Italy, “represents a kind of beautiful contradiction” in his character, Ian.
To read more from this exclusive quote and get all the details about Under the Stars, check out our exclusive look.
'Sisu: Road to Revenge'
Release Date: November 21, 2025
Prepare for some gritty action, bloody violence, and plenty of foul language as “the man who refuses to die” (Jorma Tommila) returns to the big screen on November 21. In Sisu: Road to Revenge, he faces a new foe in the form of Stephen Lang, the Red Army commander who killed his family. As per the synopsis, "a relentless, eye-popping cross-country chase ensues - a fight to the death, full of clever, unbelievable action set pieces." Ahead of the action-packed arrival, Collider has teamed up with the movie to bring you the above exclusive clip, featuring a taste of the chaotic bloodbath to come. Directed by Jalmari Helander, the Sisu sequel is produced by Mike Goodridge and Petri Jokiranta and executive produced by Gregory Ouanhon and Antonio Salas.
Get all the details about Sisu: Road to Revenge in our exclusive look.
'28 Years Later: The Bone Temple'
Release Date: January 16, 2026
Earlier this year, Danny Boyle and Alex Garland finally returned to their groundbreaking horror franchise, releasing 28 Years Later to great acclaim. The first of a new trilogy, the second installment, 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple, arrives just months after its predecessor, debuting in theaters on January 16, 2026. Ahead of the movie's release, Collider debuted the above image from The Bone Temple as part of our Exclusive Winter Preview Event, showcasing Ralph Fiennes’ Dr. Kelson and a subdued Chi Lewis-Parry's Samson inside the titular morbid structure. Directed by Nia DaCosta, the second of the trilogy is set to expand on the arrival of Jimmy Crystal (Jack O’Connell) at the end of the previous movie.
Get all the details about 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple in our exclusive look.
‘Primate’
Release Date: January 9, 2026
The Strangers: Prey at Night director Johannes Roberts’ next foray into the horror genre comes in the form of Primate, a violent, natural horror movie scheduled for release on January 9, 2026. “In PRIMATE, a group of friends’ tropical vacation turns into a terrifying, primal tale of horror and survival,” the movie’s synopsis reveals, promising a dive into the depths of despair that will leave viewers on the edge of their seat. As part of Collider’s Exclusive Winter Preview Event, we debuted this exclusive image from the film, which gives fans a closer glimpse at the terror soon to hit screens. The movie stars the likes of Johnny Sequoyah and Jessica Alexander, alongside Troy Kotsur, Victoria Wyant, Gia Hunter, Benjamin Cheng, Charlie Mann, and Tienne Simon.
Get all the details about Primate in our exclusive look.
'Merv'
